question:
You are a math expert. When you respond, respond only with the Solution of the final Problem, thinking step by step. At the end of the Solution, when you give your final answer, write it in the form 'Final Answer: \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
I have 6 shirts, 6 pairs of pants, and 6 hats.  Each item comes in the same 6 colors (so that I have one of each item of each color).  I refuse to wear an outfit in which all 3 items are the same color.  How many choices for outfits do I have?
inference:
Total outfits without restriction: $6 \times 6 \times 6 = 216$.
Outfits where all 3 items are the same color: $6$ (one choice for each color).
Number of outfits where at least one item is the same color as another item: $6$
Number of choices for outfits where all three items are the same color is $6$.
So, the number of outfits where at least two items are the same color is 6.
The number of outfits where all three items are the same color is 6.
Number of outfits where all three items are different colors is $6 \times 5 \times 4 = 120$.
Number of outfits where all three items are different colors: $6 \times 5 \times 4 = 120$
Number of choices for outfits without restriction: $6 \times 6 \times 6 = 216$.
Number of choices where all 3 items are the same color: 6.
Number of outfits where all three items are different colors: $6 \times 5 \times 4 = 120$.
Number of choices for outfits where at least two items are the same color: $216 - 120 - 6 = 90$.

Number of ways to choose 3 distinct colors from 6 colors is $\binom{6}{3} = \frac{6 \times 5 \times 4}{3 \times 2 \times 1} = 20$.
Number of outfits where all 3 items are the same color is 6.
The number of outfits where all 3 items are different colors is $6 \times 5 \times 4 = 120$.
The number of outfits where at least 2 items are the same color is $6 \times 6 \times 6 - 120 - 6 = 216 - 120 - 6 = 90$.
Final Answer: $\boxed{120}$
ground_truth: The number of all outfit combinations is $6\times 6\times 6=216$. There are 6 outfits in which all three items are the same color. Thus there are $216-6=\boxed{210}$ outfits in which not all three items are the same color.

The number of outfits where all three items are different colors is $6 \times 5 \times 4 = 120$.
